title: Emmerdale spoilers: Emotional exit for Robert and Aaron as they flee the village following Lee’s death
text:
Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) was on borrowed time after attacking Victoria’s rapist Lee in Emmerdale, but tonight his world came crashing down when he learned that Lee had died in hospital — which meant that he could end up facing a murder charge. As a result, he and husband Aaron (Danny Miller) decided to go on the run together before the police could catch up with Robert.

When Robert learned that Victoria (Isabel Hodgins) had been raped, he decided to seek revenge on behalf of his sister. As a result, he went to great lengths to antagonise Lee, and things got out of hand several months back when he picked up a shovel and hit the rapist on the back of the head. Robert was charged with a GBH with intent and, as he’s facing a stretch in prison, he’s been making the most of what time he has left with Aaron.

However, things went from bad to worse tonight, as an emotional Victoria headed round to her brother’s house to inform him that Lee had died. Robert was stunned, and didn’t know how best to proceed. However, it was Liv (Isobel Steele) who provided them with an answer, when she suggested that both him and Aaron go on the run.

Robert was clear that he didn’t want Aaron to have to face life on the run, but he had no choice in the matter, as Aaron had already made up his mind.

Later, Aaron informed Chas (Lucy Pargeter) of his plan and, while she was adamant that he was making a mistake, he was determined to stand by his husband.

As the episode drew to a conclusion, an emotional Victoria bid farewell to Robert, as both he and Aaron exited their home. They said one final emotional farewell to their nearest and dearest before getting into the car and driving off.

The question is: will the pair manage to evade the law?

With Lee having died as a result of the injuries Robert inflicted on him, the police will no doubt come calling real soon, and when they realise he’s gone, it’s likely that they’ll pull out all the stops to locate him.

What’s more, a recent trailer showed both Aaron and Robert hiding — seemingly from a police car— so they’re not out of the woods just yet.

Emmerdale continues on Tuesday 15th October at 7pm on ITV.
